Line 66: Line 66:
=== eBay policy ===
=== eBay policy ===
â
Beginning January 2006, [[eBay]] has restricted buyers and sellers from using many online payment systems and encouraged them to use [[Paypal]], which is wholly owned by eBay. eBay specifically named e-gold as one of the online payment systems that will result in them cancelling a seller's account if used. eBay cited e-gold's policy of non-reversible transactions as a detriment to the buyer experience.<ref>[http://pages.ebay.com/help/policies/safe-payments-policy.html eBay: Redirect<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
Beginning January 2006, [[eBay]] has restricted buyers and sellers from using many online payment systems and encouraged them to use [[Paypal]], which is wholly owned by eBay. eBay specifically named e-gold as one of the online payment systems that will result in them cancelling a seller's account if used. eBay cited e-gold's policy of non-reversible transactions as a detriment to the buyer experience.<ref>[http://pages.ebay.com/help/policies/safe-payments-policy.html eBay: Redirect<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>{{Failed verification|date=June 2011}}
=== E-Gold Reopens Access ===
=== E-Gold Reopens Access ===
